name: Semantic Fractal Object Definition Axiom
intent: Instantiate the SFO as the core structural object of Volume II.
constraints: An SFO is given by a functor F: Scale \-\> SemSys along with projective limit maps Î»\_n: S\_n \-\> Lim(F).
Lim(F) exists and is non-empty, representing scale-compatible semantic states.
Lim(F) captures all semantic invariants that are stable under scale transition maps.
The SFO can be realized as nested Boxes B\_n with morphisms B\_{n,i} \-\> B\_{n+1,j} encoding inheritance.
